main event: A T-33A pilot spotted a fast-moving, bright-colored light heading south near Grand Junction, Colorado in 1960. The light was tracked on radar traveling at 400-500 mph and then disappeared suddenly.
interesting points: The pilot estimated the object was 40-50 miles away from him.
The light was tracked on radar about 90 miles west of Grand Junction.
The observation was classified as 'probably a satellite re-entering'.
A second sighting near Grand Junction in 1962 described an object appearing close to the surface, heading southwest, and observed for about 5 minutes.
The 1962 sighting was reported by a Lt. Col. witness to the Air Technical Intelligence Center (ATIC).
sighted object: a fast-moving, bright-colored light and an object appearing close to the surface
witnesses: a T-33A pilot and a Lt. Col.
